question: Which country houses the glacier-capped stratovolcano "Snaefellsjokull"?
explanation: Iceland houses the glacier-capped stratovolcano "Snaefellsjokull". It is a 700,000-year-old glacier-capped stratovolcano in western Iceland. The mountain is one of the most famous sites of Iceland, primarily due to the novel Journey to the Center of the Earth (1864) by Jules Verne, in which the protagonists find the entrance to a passage leading to the centre of the earth on Snaefellsjokull.
